meanings.definition: To outdo in boldness or audacity.
meanings.sent1: She was outbrazening her competitors by taking risks others wouldn't.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outbrazen his fears by facing them head-on.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outbrazening the birds by stealing their food right in front of them.
meanings.sent4: The young artist outbrazened the critics by showcasing his unconventional paintings.
meanings.sent5: The knight outbrazened the dragon by standing fearlessly in its path.

meanings.definition: The act of displaying more boldness or audacity than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Her outbrazening of authority figures often got her into trouble.
meanings.sent2: The outbrazening of the thief shocked everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's outbrazening of the cat for the last acorn was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His outbrazening of his opponents in the debate earned him the title of champion.
meanings.sent5: The outbrazening of the storm by the old lighthouse was a sight to behold.
